intro: Hieracium donosianum, commonly known as the Donosian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium donosianum is often found in clusters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help it adapt to various environmental conditions.
